bug.short_desc: Warning Non-literal Argument to qx.core.Environment call (e.g. when building Demobrowser)

long_desc.thetext:
$ cd application/demobrowser $ ./generate.py build
>>> Collecting classes - - Warning: qx.core.Environment call without literal argument (demobrowser.demo.bom.Environment:58) - Warning: qx.core.Environment call without literal argument (demobrowser.demo.bom.Environment:76) - Warning: qx.core.Environment call without literal argument (demobrowser.demo.bom.Environment:58) - Warning: qx.core.Environment call without literal argument (demobrowser.demo.bom.Environment:76)

Thats not a surprise there but we should find a way to silence these warnings because we know that this is ok for the demo. Thomas, can you attach that report to the general report about removing the warnings?

The warnings for demobrowser.demo.bom.Environment have been addressed in the demo itself.
The final relation between the (improved) @ hints in .js files and the "config-warnings" key in config files (addressed by bug#5336) has not been settled.
Hence closing this and unlinking it from bug#5336.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
